componentOverview.description: The Button component is a reusable UI element that triggers an action when clicked. It can be customized with different sizes, colors, and states (e.g., loading, disabled).
componentOverview.whenToUse: Use the Button component when you need a clickable element to trigger actions like submitting forms, starting processes, or navigating through pages.

customizationAndTheming.theming: You can extend the default styles using Tailwind CSS classes or any CSS-in-JS solution. Pass in custom class names to override the default theme.

props.name: variant
props.description: The visual style of the button.

props.name: size
props.description: Adjusts the size of the button.

props.name: onClick
props.description: Function triggered when the button is clicked.

props.name: isLoading
props.description: Shows a loading spinner when true.

events.name: onClick
events.description: Triggered when the button is clicked.

events.name: onChange
events.description: Triggered when the value of an associated input changes.

accessibilityGuidelines.keyboardNavigation: Supports navigation via Tab, Enter, and Space keys.
accessibilityGuidelines.focusManagement: The button has proper focus management and a visible focus state.
accessibilityGuidelines.screenReaderCompatibility: The button provides screen reader compatibility with meaningful labels.

bestPractices: Ensure that button labels are clear and meaningful.
Avoid using too many visual variants in the same context.
Use the loading state only when performing a long-running task.

componentStatesAndEdgeCases.longTextState: <Button>Click me to perform a very long operation...</Button>
